endpoints.name: get
endpoints.description: Gets the specified message.

pathParameters.name: userId
pathParameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParameters.name: id
pathParameters.description: The ID of the message to retrieve.

queryParameters.name: format
queryParameters.description: The format to return the message in.

queryParameters.name: metadataHeaders
queryParameters.description: To specify comma seperated headers.For example:- Received,Date. When given and format is METADATA, only include headers specified.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response

endpoints.name: list
endpoints.description: Lists the messages in the user's mailbox.

pathParameters.name: userId
pathParameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

queryParameters.name: includeSpamTrash
queryParameters.description: Include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results. (Default: false)

queryParameters.name: labelIds
queryParameters.description: To specify comma seperated labelids. It will only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.For example:- UNREAD,DRAFT

queryParameters.name: q
queryParameters.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example:-from:someuser@example.com

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response

endpoints.name: get
endpoints.description: Gets the specified message attachment.

pathParameters.name: userId
pathParameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

pathParameters.name: messageId
pathParameters.description: The ID of the message containing the attachment.

pathParameters.name: id
pathParameters.description: The ID of the attachment.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response

endpoints.name: list
endpoints.description: Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox. History results are returned in chronological order (increasing historyId).

pathParameters.name: userId
pathParameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

queryParameters.name: historyTypes
queryParameters.description: History types to be returned by the function.

queryParameters.name: labelId
queryParameters.description: Only return messages with a label matching the ID

queryParameters.name: startHistoryId
queryParameters.description: Required. Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId. The supplied startHistoryId should be obtained from the historyId of a message, thread, or previous list response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date startHistoryId typically returns an HTTP 404 error code. A historyId is typically valid for at least a week, but in some rare circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an HTTP 404 error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no nextPageToken in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned historyId for a future request.

queryParameters.name: fields
queryParameters.description: Selector specifying a subset of fields to include in the response

queryParameters.name: includeSpamTrash
queryParameters.description: Include threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results. (Default: false)

queryParameters.name: labelIds
queryParameters.description: To specify comma seperated labelids. It will only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.For example:- UNREAD,DRAFT.

queryParameters.name: q
queryParameters.description: Only return threads matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example:-from:someuser@example.com

operations.name: insert
operations.description: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to IMAP APPEND, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

operations.name: modify
operations.description: Modifies the labels on the specified message.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to modify.

operations.name: send
operations.description: Sends the specified message to the recipients in the To, Cc, and Bcc headers.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to delete.

operations.name: trash
operations.description: Moves the specified message to the trash.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to Trash.

operations.name: untrash
operations.description: Removes the specified message from the trash.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the message to remove from Trash.

operations.name: import
operations.description: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP. Does not send a message.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

operations.name: create
operations.description: Creates a new draft with the DRAFT label.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

operations.name: update
operations.description: Replaces a draft's content.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the draft to update.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the draft to update.

operations.name: delete
operations.description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified draft. Does not simply trash it.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the draft to delete.

operations.name: send
operations.description: Sends the specified, existing draft to the recipients in the To, Cc, and Bcc headers.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

operations.description: Creates a new label.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the label to update.

operations.name: delete
operations.description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified label and removes it from any messages and threads that it is applied to.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the label to delete.

operations.name: modify
operations.description: Modifies the labels applied to the thread. This applies to all messages in the thread.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the thread to modify.

operations.name: delete
operations.description: Immediately and permanently deletes the specified thread. This operation cannot be undone.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
ID of the Thread to delete.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the thread to Trash.

operations.description: Removes the specified thread from the trash.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
The ID of the thread to remove from Trash.
